clinical_study.brief_title: The Incidence of Gall Stones After Bariatric Surgery and Its Association With Weight Loss
clinical_study.official_title: The Incidence of Gall Stones After Bariatric Surgery and Its Association With Weight Loss

brief_summary.textblock: The incidence of Gall Stones after Bariatric surgery and its association with weight loss

detailed_description.textblock: Gallstone (GS) formation is common in obese patients, particularly during rapid weight loss.This study aimed to determine the incidence of GS in patients underwent bariatric surgery (BS) and the influence of weight loss on GS formation.

primary_outcome.measure: The incidence of Gall Stones after Bariatric surgery
primary_outcome.time_frame: the period between December 2018 and December 2019

secondary_outcome.measure: effect of weight loss on Gall Stones formation after Bariatric surgery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: the period between December 2018 and December 2019
secondary_outcome.description: effect of excess weight loss on gall stones formation after bariatric surgery

clinical_study.condition: The Incidence of Gall Stones After Bariatric Surgery and Its Association With Weight Loss

study_pop.textblock: Methods This was a prospective study conducted in Helwan University Hospitals in Egypt including 148 consecutive patients underwent BS during the period between December 2018 and December 2019. Patients with preoperative negative abdominal ultrasound(US) for GS were followed-up for at least 12 months.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- (BMI) ≥35kg/m2 with one or more obesity-related comorbidities
- a BMI > 40 kg/m2 without coexisting medical problems
Exclusion Criteria:
-a conrtaindication for bariatric surgery
